q: How do pavers handle Bend winters?
a: We build on a properly compacted base with edge restraint and polymeric sand. Pavers flex and can be lifted and reset if needed—no cracking like monolithic slabs.

q: Do you seal stone or pavers?
a: Optional. Sealers add color depth and stain resistance, but require maintenance. We review pros and cons for each material.

q: What is the typical lead time?
a: Our schedule fluctuates with the seasons. Spring and summer book quickly, so expect 4–6 weeks. Winter work is available for smaller installs.

q: Do you handle permitting and utility locates?
a: Yes. We coordinate locates, drainage planning, and will advise on permits when structural walls or gas lines are involved.
